result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven E Corstvet

defendant.name: Corstvet, Steven E

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Defendant Steven E Corstvet in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Steven E Corstvet.  Attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. Village of Butler Police Department Officer Joel Fus sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Tempelis. Cross examination by Attorney Gutierrez. Redirect by Attorney Tempelis. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Gutierrez objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Report re: Status of Compliance filed by WCS

9:37 AM Defendant Steven E Corstvet in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Steven E Corstvet.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes Attorney Gutierrez previously filed an adjournment request but due to Marsy's Law, the Court was unable to adjourn off the record. Attorney Gutierrez continues his request for an adjournment. No objection by the State. The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Letter dated 08/31/2022 requesting adjournment filed by plaintiff.
08/31/2022 Per Comm Rieck. There is an alleged victim in this matter so Marsy's Law applies. The Court cannot take the date off the calendar but will amend the date to a status hearing for scheduling purposes.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision. 
ADDITIONAL CONDITION:If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

Atty. Gutierrez requests an adjournment for order appointing counsel to be filed.  State takes no position and the officer is present.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing after court today. Time limit were previously waived.
Court modifies bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
